title: what is wrong with riot constantly updating things to be even worse than they were?
body: not to mention the whole runes being broken as fuck now and whatever else, gameplay is another story. the new client is GARBAGE. entire sections don't work. you have to relog 4 or 5 times for things to start working. you can't start a new game with your friends from a previous game to play again, they have to quit and get a new invite. you can't bring up half the menu's it just creates little boxes to click out of and freezes. the worst one, the one that annoys me the most, is AMBIENT SOUNDS are now SFX sounds, so if i want to hear when someone messages me or invites me to a game, i have to have the shitty background sound on at all times. if i leave my lol client open and want to hear if a friend gets on and invites me in the background the ambient sound is always playing and its annoying as fuck. which riot employee creating this thought this was a good idea? how mentally deficient do you have to be to think adding sfx and ambient sounds into one slider is an ok thing to do? the whole new client is a garbage endeavour and completely typical of riot, they created it when there was NOTHING wrong with the old one. they seem to go out of their way to remake things as broken as possible to give them things to work on.

replies.body:
Cos this game is total shit and the focus is on pumping out new champs and skins?

I don't ever recall League being in such a terrible state but really, who gives a shit. This game has fast become a joke and should be taken that way.

> [{quoted}](name=JesusForgotHisGA,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=HolIvpUK,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-11-20T08:59:39.092+0000)
>
> Cos this game is total shit and the focus is on pumping out new champs and skins?
> 
> I don't ever recall League being in such a terrible state but really, who gives a shit. This game has fast become a joke and should be taken that way.

The focus is profit. The vehicle is skins and a now exploitative currency system.

It is a bit odd, they keep making changes that seems to not go well with public reception, but I have to say they seem to be top class at actually communicating with their audience and trying to register what they are thinking. They're constantly putting out in-depth articles detailing what's coming up, offering user satisfaction polls, and so on, but then they seem to ignore it all and do what people aren't really interested in anyway sometimes.

Ambient client sounds should definitely be separately adjustable from client alerts. I need to be able to hear when the queue pops a match, but then there's this super loud ringing and clanging and crap for 10 seconds after and constant chiming noises during the lobby process that I just want to shut up. It takes minutes to get into a match, and that's if the lobby doesn't dodge which is often does, and I take very little of it to do my part, but when I try to watch some Youtube in the meantime the ambient sounds are insufferable. I just want to hear important alerts for when I need to pick or accept something, and nothing else. However for your situation, if you're just idling in the client and want to hear invites then do so in the main landing screen, there is no ambient sound there. It's only when you sit in the pre-lobby area will it be making noise.

>but then they seem to ignore it all and do what people aren't really interested in anyway sometimes.

Welcome to the world of big corporations, look like you give a shit while you rake the cash in and don't give a fuck.

Riot have always been very responsive to the market and their constant revisions have kept them neck and neck with any main competitors that come into the mix and there is always pressure to ensure that they dont fall behind in an area where a competitor is excelling, eg:

https://www.kotaku.com.au/2015/06/league-and-dota-2-are-both-becoming-a-bit-more-like-heroes-of-the-storm/

(there was another really good article which articulated this better than I can but I cant find it).

But these were all gameplay related just to make sure that LoL could offer a similar experience to its players without letting the competition get an edge.

Widely accepted, though, was that the FTP model in League was streets ahead of the rest. But sadly, it looks like they've copied the blizzard loot box model which is utterly infuriating for older players like me who are turned off at the thought of burning a sh!t load of cash for the "chance" to get something. And not to mention this is an exploitative model which preys upon the addictive personalities of younger people perhaps not yet able to know the value of cash (because they are not forking out their own) and not emotionally aware enough to realise that they are getting fleeced.

Really disagree with the direction that BE / IP / RP have gone.
